pullRequest.title: Add support for listing additional modules to build.
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR aims to address a problem that was introduced with the POM restructuring where the -am switch which targets the shipping artifacts doesn't include some internal only modules (like azure-cosmos-benchmark).
Aiming to get this up and running for Cosmos first since they have the immediate need, but we'll also use this on things like Core which we also want to build downstream dependents.

commit.message: Add support for listing additional modules to build.
Flesh out tests.yml with additional modules.
Add additional module in core for validation purposes.
Added additional modules parameter to build step in main template.

nodes.bodyText: I'm not sure I fully understand why we need to add this here. Doesn't appconfig depend on Core and thus the -am should cause it to build?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -57,3 +57,6 @@ stages:
         - name: azure-core-tracing-opentelemetry
           groupId: com.azure
           safeName: azurecoretracingopentelemetry
+      AdditionalModules:
+        - name: azure-data-appconfiguration

nodes.bodyText: I'm not liking the fact that this particular change looks a lot like we're adding an appconfig dependency to core in a very roundabout way.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -57,3 +57,6 @@ stages:
         - name: azure-core-tracing-opentelemetry
           groupId: com.azure
           safeName: azurecoretracingopentelemetry
+      AdditionalModules:
+        - name: azure-data-appconfiguration

nodes.bodyText:
@kushagraThapar @mitchdenny @weshaggard
I realize that we're doing this to allow Cosmos pipelines to pass but the examples and benchmark libraries are supposed to be going away which means that these specific edits should ultimately be going away.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -45,3 +45,8 @@ stages:
         - name: azure-cosmos
           groupId: com.azure
           safeName: azurecosmos
+      AdditionalModules:
